TopicTitle: The Kerbal Space Program community Space Station Project!

Articles.Content:
Hello fellow Pilots, I am here today to announce the:

International Simulator Space Station Project

Or ISSS if you want to be cool. The plan is to, with the help of persistence file editing to make a Space Station together.

Some rules:

1:

Only mods allowed are:

Hyperedit (to get the space station up in orbit)

Kerbal Engineer Redux

Mechjeb

2:

No rearranging/deleting already existing modules.

3:

Your part must contain at least one docking port to which other people can dock.

4:

Only the standard docking ports are allowed.

5:

Be creative, but keep it within the limits of the CPU.

6:

Make photo's!

7:

No cheating to get your module into orbit.

8:

The module must have room for at least one Kerbal.

9:

Have fun!

Edited April 23, 2015 by pauldbk99

Only mods allowed are:

Hyperedit (to get the space station up in orbit)

Mechjeb

No cheating to get your module into orbit.
Ehehehehehe

E: In case it blows up, I'm only kidding about MechJeb (it's just been a meme for so long)...

Edited April 23, 2015 by regex
My literally first though when I saw the title: "Isn't this a bit ambitious, the community cube sat isn't even launched yet and now a station?"

Instead of making another community space station- please revive this instead (there's work already on it anyway

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/76210-REVIVED%21%21-Kerbal-Space-Station-Project-%28KSSP%29
